climbs.name: More Fun Than I Thought
climbs.fa: First recorded ascent: Celeste G. & Joe M, 3 October 2020

content.description:
P1, 55m: Boulder up the little wall (5.0) to immediately lower angle 3rd and 4th class. Run out the rope ~ 55m to intersect a little fern gulley directly under the prominent dihedral in the center of the wall. Belay off nuts or small cams (possible slung block too). This pitch can likely be avoided by scrambling in lookers left of the start and up the gulley.

P2, 35m: Climb straight up the right wall of the dihedral, following the central line above up past blocky rock and a chockstone. Belay in cracks at the top of the dome where the angle kicks back.
content.location: Identify a short, steep wall near the apex of the base of the cliff, near a nice boulder to your left if facing the wall. The prominent dihedral in the center of the cliff will be directly overhead.
